title: How to Make Cocoa Coated Crunchy Almonds

steps.headline: Blend the cocoa powder with the butter in a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Blend until it forms a thick paste.

steps.headline: Heat the cocoa mixture.
steps.description: Fill a saucepan with water about 1/4 the way. Add the cocoa mixture in a heatproof bowl that fits into the saucepan. (Alternatively, use a double boiler).

steps.headline: Stir over the heat until the cocoa mixture is hot but not cooked.
steps.description: Remove from the heat and transfer to a mixing bowl.

steps.headline: Add the sugar and milk to the heated cocoa mixture.
steps.description: Keep stirring constantly, adding the sugar and milk gradually. Taste the cocoa mixture. See whether it could benefit from the addition of more sugar; if so, add some.

steps.headline: Done.
steps.description: This cocoa mixture forms the coating for the almonds. Set aside for now.

steps.headline: Peel the covering off the crunchy almonds.
Dip the crunchy almonds into the cocoa mixture.
Lay the dipped crunchy almonds on a baking sheet or tray covered in parchment or wax paper.
Place the baking sheet of all the dipped chocolates into the freezer.
steps.description: Allow to set for an hour or so.

steps.headline: Remove from the freezer.
steps.description: Arrange the cocoa coated crunchy almonds on a plate for serving. The cocoa coated crunchy almonds are ready to serve. Enjoy.

text: Making the cocoa mixture Blend the cocoa powder with the butter in a mixing bowl. Blend until it forms a thick paste. Heat the cocoa mixture. Fill a saucepan with water about 1/4 the way. Add the cocoa mixture in a heatproof bowl that fits into the saucepan. (Alternatively, use a double boiler). Stir over the heat until the cocoa mixture is hot but not cooked. Remove from the heat and transfer to a mixing bowl. Add the sugar and milk to the heated cocoa mixture. Keep stirring constantly, adding the sugar and milk gradually. Taste the cocoa mixture. See whether it could benefit from the addition of more sugar; if so, add some. Done. This cocoa mixture forms the coating for the almonds. Set aside for now. Creating the almond shaped chocolates Peel the covering off the crunchy almonds.  Dip the crunchy almonds into the cocoa mixture. Do this one by one. Lay the dipped crunchy almonds on a baking sheet or tray covered in parchment or wax paper.  Place the baking sheet of all the dipped chocolates into the freezer. Allow to set for an hour or so. Remove from the freezer. Arrange the cocoa coated crunchy almonds on a plate for serving. The cocoa coated crunchy almonds are ready to serve. Enjoy.
